document.title: Texas Essential Knowledge and Skills for Kindergarten

F02708EB78294A80BD7544EE315F9023.description:
use an appropriate mode of delivery, whether written, oral, or multimodal, to present
results.

C185D18539884D4BB453DD8BB1BB6BB2.description: demonstrate understanding of information gathered with adult assistance; and

5B085D5C3CBA4922A32E728BAEE115CE.description: gather information from a variety of sources with adult assistance;

1FFB058E66FC46F2A22FBF57C2F6BA16.description: develop and follow a research plan with adult assistance;

821FBAEB0C2B4328AC6177CBA4519C08.description: generate questions for formal and informal inquiry with adult assistance;

FD1FA815D61F4DB5B23A18D69426C14A.description:
Inquiry and research: listening, speaking, reading, writing, and thinking using multiple texts. The
student engages in both short-term and sustained recursive inquiry processes for a variety of
purposes. The student is expected to:

E48877A545F143EF9FAF5A8CE27AF999.description: dictate or compose literary texts, including personal narratives;

E3E07D991D73424E82470A922E0F666B.description:
Composition: listening, speaking, reading, writing, and thinking using multiple texts--genres. The
student uses genre characteristics and craft to compose multiple texts that are meaningful. The
student is expected to:

C1BEB9283D6E413BBDDAE4886CA7C5BD.description:
correct spelling of words with grade-appropriate orthographic patterns and rules
and high-frequency words; and

6526B8A0001E4EFBBFC99DB35681CA32.description: punctuation marks at the end of declarative sentences; and

E96C5EEC638F4545A9FD9B213E6203B1.description: capitalization of the first letter in a sentence and name;

4CC67A6C55FE47228D3535983B942BDB.description: pronouns, including subjective, objective, and possessive cases;

92C48C8E38654EB8AB390A67DAFDACAA.description: edit drafts with adult assistance using standard English conventions, including:

8A5AB104EBE74324BEF811DB3A872127.description: revise drafts by adding details in pictures or words;

7C65EC9257BA4929AB1605AC7B438125.description: develop drafts in oral, pictorial, or written form by organizing ideas;

116CD4A8565D4F319ABC8AEE0A6B7DD9.description: plan by generating ideas for writing through class discussions and drawings;

82B6B0A96F7B4F45B38D3BD782F6AEB5.description:
Composition: listening, speaking, reading, writing, and thinking using multiple texts--writing
process. The student uses the writing process recursively to compose multiple texts that are
legible and uses appropriate conventions. The student is expected to:

F6F6FEE9785D43CF84256D22D453DE7F.description: listen to and experience first- and third-person texts.

DFC8EDEB71DF494C95A52AF5CFCC0336.description: discuss with adult assistance how the author uses words that help the reader visualize;

A6E42A3AE98445978D0A4342D9D1451C.description:
discuss with adult assistance the author's use of print and graphic features to achieve
specific purposes;

9301B770980F44379A3A55A4C3121097.description:
discuss with adult assistance how the use of text structure contributes to the author's
purpose;

9AF5A058509344ECB4BCE19DB792819E.description: discuss with adult assistance the author's purpose for writing text;

E102EF8B45AD43518CA0C9E31AF92AA6.description:
Author's purpose and craft: listening, speaking, reading, writing, and thinking using multiple
texts. The student uses critical inquiry to analyze the authors' choices and how they influence and
communicate meaning within a variety of texts. The student analyzes and applies author's craft
purposefully in order to develop his or her own products and performances. The student is
expected to:

6392EA84DD244024A81FB89A08D74F2D.description: recognize characteristics of multimodal and digital texts.

43D13F10D0B54119A61A1AAD5166A379.description:
recognize characteristics of persuasive text with adult assistance and state what the author
is trying to persuade the reader to think or do;

C4C031F2F08A4EF3970E31B0CB2F4EF2.description: the steps in a sequence with adult assistance;

8C45278EBCF742F7A0E1A1A76257D2FA.description: titles and simple graphics to gain information; and

5FC3393704744DA4B8EF0352B10DE754.description: the central idea and supporting evidence with adult assistance;

9ABA61F9C5134F88ACCC65E544A92972.description: recognize characteristics and structures of informational text, including:

6E4FE62231E14AACBB13873782ED1A65.description: discuss rhyme and rhythm in nursery rhymes and a variety of poems;

42252C2387FA4AB3AC6F506B3544B470.description:
demonstrate knowledge of distinguishing characteristics of well-known children's
literature such as folktales, fables, fairy tales, and nursery rhymes;

6D6D5909B10644D6A91A975B9CF49761.description:
Multiple genres: listening, speaking, reading, writing, and thinking using multiple texts--genres.
The student recognizes and analyzes genre-specific characteristics, structures, and purposes
within and across increasingly complex traditional, contemporary, classical, and diverse texts.
The student is expected to:

6DD2FA52DEC541B6B0973441897DFBC3.description:
describe the elements of plot development, including the main events, the problem, and
the resolution for texts read aloud with adult assistance; and

A7AF11889BCF4D68807ED734D2A058DD.description: identify and describe the main character(s);

7095350E6D98486A9A3D018D7472192B.description: discuss topics and determine the basic theme using text evidence with adult assistance;

7446531362CD4CDCA8CE8000B584385E.description:
Multiple genres: listening, speaking, reading, writing, and thinking using multiple texts--literary
elements. The student recognizes and analyzes literary elements within and across increasingly
complex traditional, contemporary, classical, and diverse literary texts. The student is expected
to:

C603C4AD14EF46249A22E25E005EFEAC.description: respond using newly acquired vocabulary as appropriate.

8EA69357076D45ED930CF86DD0640E7F.description: interact with sources in meaningful ways such as illustrating or writing; and

8A4F91F544984AB2BF0B49FB41A01420.description: retell texts in ways that maintain meaning;

3DE06D137A214CD980D3C211E4BE2CDF.description: use text evidence to support an appropriate response;

25042C30869F4183B9E9DAF17A1F0A32.description: provide an oral, pictorial, or written response to a text;

DBC9120673754F42B2C05E2FE353098E.description: describe personal connections to a variety of sources;

BCC7D6886D5A45FCB3FDB02742E45443.description:
Response skills: listening, speaking, reading, writing, and thinking using multiple texts. The
student responds to an increasingly challenging variety of sources that are read, heard, or viewed.
The student is expected to:

C1AB2456F5F542D08D35FB402EF133B2.description:
monitor comprehension and make adjustments such as re-reading, using background
knowledge, checking for visual cues, and asking questions when understanding breaks
down with adult assistance.

EA9FDB72432A41C9BDCF9499DBC51292.description: synthesize information to create new understanding with adult assistance; and

9E3DEA3BA3AA41118343AF0A07CFB867.description: evaluate details to determine what is most important with adult assistance;

3B1F6DD725534C43AAF696D2E805873F.description: make inferences and use evidence to support understanding with adult assistance;

1775490DFEF2464DB5DA7DFF744EE6C3.description:
make connections to personal experiences, ideas in other texts, and society with adult
assistance;

26A8841B68F54EAE92F7547C69B7A68E.description: create mental images to deepen understanding with adult assistance;

7651A89B39FA4808A57A9C375917C7AF.description: make and confirm predictions using text features and structures with adult assistance;

145789B416C547039BD93A5CF05CDB6A.description:
generate questions about text before, during, and after reading to deepen understanding
and gain information with adult assistance;

072132A85FFE4BD1B7F0BCFED2CC8726.description: establish purpose for reading assigned and self-selected texts with adult assistance;

99A1A08827824FC5A0F516290A5028D0.description:
Comprehension skills: listening, speaking, reading, writing, and thinking using multiple texts.
The student uses metacognitive skills to both develop and deepen comprehension of increasingly
complex texts. The student is expected to:

6D998884C99F4460B90458B6A9AC7348.description:
Developing and sustaining foundational language skills: listening, speaking, reading, writing, and
thinking--self-sustained reading. The student reads grade-appropriate texts independently. The
student is expected to self-select text and interact independently with text for increasing periods
of time.

93947F11ACA146A88A07B24BC73E72D6.description:
identify and use words that name actions; directions; positions; sequences; categories
such as colors, shapes, and textures; and locations.

087D5A38234C4DE5915AFB8ED01B7112.description:
use illustrations and texts the student is able to read or hear to learn or clarify word
meanings; and

F4787F522D484376AB9734FBF8B9E4C0.description: use a resource such as a picture dictionary or digital resource to find words;

B6A3190AD84045C28EE5F7E029D5BA7A.description:
Developing and sustaining foundational language skills: listening, speaking, reading, writing, and
thinking--vocabulary. The student uses newly acquired vocabulary expressively. The student is
expected to:

3E0163BEB2434BCF8941B5F3E6F7698E.description:
develop handwriting by accurately forming all uppercase and lowercase letters using
appropriate directionality.

94ECDAEFB73C403DB9FD27CADD212EDB.description: identifying all uppercase and lowercase letters; and

ECB65AAB3DE24519B9157D6F7F21A5DB.description: recognizing the difference between a letter and a printed word; and

AE83E2DCAC1B47579045B4DD804C67A6.description:
recognizing that sentences are comprised of words separated by spaces and
recognizing word boundaries;

5513520CDA50497C805F624CBA1A0BD5.description:
holding a book right side up, turning pages correctly, and knowing that reading
moves from top to bottom and left to right with return sweep;

D021E7367A714F0290F80AD11DF0FC8F.description: identifying the front cover, back cover, and title page of a book;

D39C6162F6E141738DEA72713629B5F9.description: spelling high-frequency words from a research-based list;

1ADCC7A609CC488B86448E8B6CF92D8C.description: spelling words using sound-spelling patterns; and

A8C5C9411A7B4C0CA975156B421927D9.description: spelling words with VC, CVC, and CCVC;

17C182E46711467C9432CC2DAA8A2E07.description: demonstrate and apply spelling knowledge by:

259AA1CCF29945F5BEAD371189B76EE5.description:
identifying and reading at least 25 high-frequency words from a research-based
list;

A1CFC65198444B8CAC5950ECEB09A268.description:
recognizing that new words are created when letters are changed, added, or
deleted such as it - pit - tip - tap; and

82569C9CBF2E4F2C8A910BFE02DC17C0.description:
using letter-sound relationships to decode, including VC, CVC, CCVC, and
CVCC words;

D88142DFD09743BAB32E9228383A7F04.description: identifying and matching the common sounds that letters represent;

C0F8E54AEB604D769E3B3FF8E4D91B1A.description: demonstrate and apply phonetic knowledge by:

FE328CFB1BB942E083E4B5A594F0FFDA.description: segmenting spoken one-syllable words into individual phonemes;

EA3149312CD54D4FB7A43A150AF03C2F.description: manipulating syllables within a multisyllabic word;

605AC083DA7F4B8D82E37438A998FEFC.description: blending spoken phonemes to form one-syllable words;

164FE3CC2F4F412785BFE988E22A94EA.description: blending spoken onsets and rimes to form simple words;

20AD016A249846709C134CE4EA89FC02.description: blending syllables to form multisyllabic words;

71CA3D3269594C7A98AA0539DE763D1A.description: identifying the individual words in a spoken sentence;

FCE95535091344DDADDEFAC65BFF698B.description:
recognizing spoken alliteration or groups of words that begin with the same
spoken onset or initial sound;

8147F538EAF14904AE51F2545A8ECA8E.description:
Developing and sustaining foundational language skills: listening, speaking, reading, writing, and
thinking--beginning reading and writing. The student develops word structure knowledge through
phonological awareness, print concepts, phonics, and morphology to communicate, decode, and
spell. The student is expected to:

FCCD8B2CF76A4C339231C125B941BA5B.description:
develop social communication such as introducing himself/herself, using common
greetings, and expressing needs and wants.

767B4BAFFF204F5D8999CD48753B7BA0.description:
work collaboratively with others by following agreed-upon rules for discussion, including
taking turns; and

98D4681E06E043D38331A6AE37485733.description:
share information and ideas by speaking audibly and clearly using the conventions of
language;

1963C45A08F54066AA2A7ED795E4E670.description: restate and follow oral directions that involve a short, related sequence of actions;

F9CCCC16E9C2445E914A831863621F1F.description:
listen actively and ask questions to understand information and answer questions using
multi-word responses;

2B33662805B74D6BB9C6AEAC5B41D7AA.description:
Developing and sustaining foundational language skills: listening, speaking, discussion, and
thinking--oral language. The student develops oral language through listening, speaking, and
discussion. The student is expected to
